alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 10:46AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wayne, south central Pulaski and western McCreary Counties through 1130 AM EDT... At 1045 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jamestown to near Cabell to 6 miles northwest of Byrdstown. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monticello, Burnside, Parmleysville, Great Meadows Campsites, Slavens, Susie, Sloans Valley, Barrier, Parnell, Gregory, Co- Operative, Slickford, Ritner, Cabell, Denney, Kidder, Powersburg, Wiborg, Oil Valley and Coopersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
